website_summaries.verdict: This lovely contemporary saddle stool is of a simple design, yet comfortable and sturdy. Comes in a classic antique walnut finish.
pros: All tools needed to assemble are included
Quick and easy to put together
Solid construction made from natural hardwood
Offers exceptional value for the quality you get
cons: Some users find these uncomfortable to sit on for extended periods

customer_reviews.title: Great quality and value!
customer_reviews.text: Great counter stools. Fit perfectly with my counters. Relatively easy to put together (for 58 yr old grandma). Husband weighs approx. 225# and is comfortable. Quality product at a value price ($26). Would highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Wdwreads

customer_reviews.title: You get what you pay for!
customer_reviews.text: I puchased these stools, four of them, about a year and a half ago. they are comfortable and nice looking BUT they do not hold up over time. The joints do not stay stable, we tried gluing them and using longer screws, we tried fixing them again and again and they became wobbly within days or weeks. Only two of the four are even usable anymore and they are fading fast! Not worth them money as I now have to replace them!
customer_reviews.author: Heather N. Voss

customer_reviews.title: NOT a Stool, but a Pretty Plant Stand
customer_reviews.text: We bought in the fall of 2015 and like K. Slovak wrote in their review, we've concluded that these are a pretty product but NOT functional as a stool. We assembled these carefully and then attached the assembly tools to the bottom of the stool thinking we might need them someday. Little did we know that we would need them almost everyday. The screws simply will not stay tight rendering the product unsafe for it's intended use.. So it's good for a plant stand, but not a stool. Stool rating = 1 star. Plant stand rating = 2+ stars. Definitely NOT recommended as a stool.
customer_reviews.author: Benedict Rocks

customer_reviews.title: Nice chair, good quality
customer_reviews.text: Good quality chair. Don't agree with many poor reviews concerning assembly difficulty, bad screws and such. Pretty easy to assemble if you follow the simple instructions. The provided Allen wrench works OK for the chair assembly. If you have an electric drill and correct bits it's easier but you'll still need the Allen wrench unless you have an angle drill attachment. The screws are actually quite heavy and shouldn't be a problem for chair longevity. Gluing and screwing the chair together would be a good idea but maybe not really necessary.
customer_reviews.author: Tiger Woops

customer_reviews.title: Great bathroom stool for putting socks on
customer_reviews.text: I gave my son and his girlfriend entertainment one evening by assembling this. I didnt notice the red dots on the legs and was complianing that it would have been nice if it were better labeled when suddenly I realized it was labeled& I had assembled it incorrectly. It also requires some pushing to get the legs to fit (it is meant to have a curve to the legs) so they got a kick out of my faces. Anyhow, it is definitely sturdy-I use it to put lotion on my feet when dressing after showering and it holds up my plus size body so I am pleased. No more falling over trying to put my socks on.
customer_reviews.author: Teliantes from NH

customer_reviews.title: The stool itself is great. It looks very nice
customer_reviews.text: The stool itself is great. It looks very nice. The problem is the included screws. They're total crap. Every single one of them stripped. I had to use a vice grip wrench to get them back out. They're also odd screws. I can't seem to get something similar at a local hardware store. I've read another review with some very specific instruction about how to not strip the heads. This is completely unacceptable. This is extremely disappointing. I now have a half assembled stool that in order to return it I'm probably going to have to break it's legs apart.
customer_reviews.author: cruton

customer_reviews.title: Super nice
customer_reviews.text: These stools really surprised me. I bought these as a "they aren't my first choice, but they'll work." I had just gotten rid of some painted black stools with high backs and about 609 nooks and crannies. I sold them and promised myself I'd never buy black again. These are SO EASY TO CLEAN!!! They have now become my favorite stools I've ever owned. I have three & when I have a lot of my kids friends over, we push them all together & make a huge "bench". We'll end up fitting 5-6 kids on 3 stools. They become loose every couple months but we just tighten them up again & they're good to go.
customer_reviews.author: Angie M

customer_reviews.title: 24" unbox and build
customer_reviews.text: This was precisely what I was looking for. When I first opened the box I had a bad feeling it was going to be too short (24"), but after trying it out, I am glad I did not get the taller stool. I will be using this for Youtube reviews and on camera interviews. I created a little unboxing / build video as well - Check it out. ​
customer_reviews.author: Nicholas Thompson

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy stool- looks as pictured-easy to assemble
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for an economical all wood 24" height stool and this fit the bill nicely. There is no leather or fabric top to get ripped but it has a nice concave wood seat. It is not the most comfortable stool if you are going to be sitting for a long time, but for a computer station in my kitchen it is perfect. It came well packaged but did need to be assembled. I am a woman and was able to assemble it with the enclosed tool in about 15 minutes with no problems. Seems sturdy and the color matches exactly as it appears online. Overall a good basic purchase in my estimation.
customer_reviews.author: mom2three

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy, good looking, made of actual wood!
customer_reviews.text: Unsure why folks seem to be having such a hard time assembling these. I put the first of two together using the supplied allen wrench, while a little time consuming there were no issues. A cordless drill (used judiciously) with the correct bit made assembling the second one much quicker. A 1/4" ratchet with the appropriate bit would make it that much quicker as the top to leg connection can't be done with a conventional power tool. Once assembled, these are exceptionally nice looking and sturdy, made of actual wood with the finish and color very even. I would recommend some sort of felt pad or plastic slider be installed for the legs. Overall very happy with them.
customer_reviews.author: J LI NY

customer_reviews.title: Quality wood. Looks good
customer_reviews.text: After reading all the reviews I though this stool would be the right one for me. It came in 2 days as promised. My husband who is not a diy was able to put it together himself using the tool and screws in the box in under an hour. It is very sturdy and just the right for my counter and sink It also matches the center island and cabinets.
customer_reviews.author: Kathleen

customer_reviews.title: Most difficult to assemble..only 12 screws 1 and 1/2 hours I'm an auto mechanic
customer_reviews.text: twelve screws and a very short Allen wrench come with the wood pieces for assembly. The big problem is the wrench is too small for the under drilled holes. Could be they don't use sharp enough drill bits or the predrilled holes are made too fast. I have made cabinets in the garage. If, as given, you use too small a drill for the thickness of the screws it becomes very difficult to tighten them as in this case. What should have been at most a half hour job turned into a frustrating hour and a half ... (for 12 blinking screws).. can't recommend..
customer_reviews.author: Fredrick H.

customer_reviews.title: Nice stool
customer_reviews.text: I ordered it to have somewhere to sit when I visit my husbands workshop. Fyi. Two people are best for putting this together. It has an allen wrench to use to screw in the screws so that is a bit awkward and tough in places. Over all it took about 20 minutes to assemble so not bad in my opinion. Advise that you study the part list and parts and assembly pictures before starting because the instructions are mainly pictures. It is a cute little bench, nice and sturdy. I like the looks of it. Stain is nice, solid wood. And its comfortable to sit on Would recommend for anyone who needs an attractive functional stool
customer_reviews.author: L. Mast

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful, sturdy and super easy to assemble
customer_reviews.text: These barstools are super sturdy and absolutely beautiful. I wanted something that would last, be easy to clean and blend in nicely with my more natural decor style. After searching literally for months, I decided on these. They arrived quickly, well packaged, all pieces included and are truly beautiful. I am so glad I went with these instead of some others that I was considering. It took less than 30 minutes to put 3 of these together. After the first one, the other 2 were super easy. I just put on some music and was done in no time. Very pleased and highly recommend. 👍👍👍
customer_reviews.author: maggies mom

customer_reviews.title: Don’t buy! Can’t put together! Waste of time.
customer_reviews.text: For the first time in years with Amazon I am returning a product. I have never returned anything! These are impossible to put together. Do not buy! The product looks great and very sturdy but did me no good as we couldn’t put them together. Never ever have I had a problem with anything I have put together in all my years. This was a huge waste of time!! Very frustrated!
customer_reviews.author: Mary T

customer_reviews.title: Great for $23.60 but NOT $38.70!!!
customer_reviews.text: You definitely need two people to put this together and it (eventually) turned out nice. We were going to place an order for a second but the price suddenly skyrocketed from 23.60 to 38.70 - it's worth the 24 bucks ONLY with the hassle, the wood is nice although ours had a small dent and scratch in the seat top which didn't matter because I'm using it with a work bench.
customer_reviews.author: Barbara West

customer_reviews.title: Difficult to put together!
customer_reviews.text: While I appreciate that these are very sturdy made stools, and I like the style, I had a very hard time putting the things together. If I hadn't had help, I would have considered returning them after I had so much trouble with the first one and going to the store to buy pre-assembled ones. Sure glad I bought three now, because I would be hesitant to buy more in the future. I put a large set of bunk beds with stairs together by myself, with more ease than I had Alan wrenching these frustrating things together. Now that they are assembled, they are nice, at least.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: However I decided to return this item for good - it may not hold up any weight
customer_reviews.text: I'm a petite 61 year old person. As I was assembling this item, the cross bar broke with not much effort. Returned and got a new one in a short time. However I decided to return this item for good - it may not hold up any weight.
customer_reviews.author: Susan

customer_reviews.title: Good stool but . . .
customer_reviews.text: Good reasonably priced stool. A bit cumbersome to assemble. Would have been easier if leg posts were attached with bolts instead of Allen head screws but I suppose the idea was that the buyer need not have any tools of their own to assemble but even so that’s not really the case as a rubber mallet in very useful for fully inserting the wood plugs in the legs’ screw holes. Hopefully this stool will hold up for a while. I’ll give it an A for price and looks, B for comfort, and a C- for assembly ease only using the materials provided.
customer_reviews.author: Nat

customer_reviews.title: Could be easier to assemble...
customer_reviews.text: Good looking stool. Attaching the legs to the actual seat was fairly difficult for me as my drill was too big, so I had to use the allen wrench it came with (dreadful). You have to keep taking it out and repositioning and turning every half turn, and the screws are long so prepared to spend at least 45 mins assembling 1 stool, and ending up with a sore thumb afterwards (i had 2 stools to assemble). Attaching the foot supports were easier since you can just use a drill for those. Once assembled it feels very sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: CaliMermaid

customer_reviews.title: ... bought two of these for our apartment and I love them and how they look
customer_reviews.text: My husband and I bought two of these for our apartment and I love them and how they look. they were easy to assemble, but it takes a lot of labor to get everything tightened-- my hands were a bit sore afterward. Might be because I have noodle arms, haha. Anyway. They are very sturdy and not wobbly in the least. I'm about ~170 lb and have no problem sitting on these or have any worry that my girth might make them suddenly break in half or collapse. My cats also love to nap on the seats in the afternoon, which is always a plus!
customer_reviews.author: Emily S.

customer_reviews.title: Junk
customer_reviews.text: Worked fine for all of 1 month. I pulled the stool along the carpet it sits on so I could vacuum and the leg literally just sheared off. Total cheap POS. I should have expected that for how cheap these are. Glad no one was sitting on it when it broke.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful, sturdy
customer_reviews.text: I love this stool. I have a small space and it works perfectly. It sparks joy every time I see it. I did struggle a bit with assembly. It requires some real muscle. But I got it done myself, which I'm proud of. I had to use pliers to help turn the allen wrench. Two of the screws ended up getting stripped, so I used a slightly larger allen wrench that I had, and that worked. I also had to use super glue to get the little pegs to stay in on top of the screw holes. But the finished product is very sturdy and looks as if it will last.
customer_reviews.author: Christy

customer_reviews.title: I love this!
customer_reviews.text: Arrived in perfect condition, well-packaged. Not too tough to put together. Do listen to the rest of the reviewers and use your own tools rather than the one included. I cannot imagine putting this thing together with that little leverage for turning the screws. I hope it will be as durable as it seems right out of the box. Given the price, I'm amazed at how sturdy it feels. I'll check back in in a few months if I can remember to and update with that info. This stool doesn't come with any pads or foot-thingys (technical term) so if you're going to use it on hard floors, you might want to get some felt pads for the bottoms.
customer_reviews.author: Cindy Dyer

customer_reviews.title: Needs bigger pilot holes to ease assembly
customer_reviews.text: For the price point, this is a great little barstool. Looks nice and fits perfectly for our countertops. HOWEVER, the hardware is garbage. I ordered 3 of them, and after stripping out some of the screws with the Allen key in the first one, I discovered that drilling the pilot holes a little larger with my 7/32 drill bit made a world of difference. Still a secure fit, but not destroying the screws trying to crank them in. Do yourself a favor and bust out your drill bits if the screws are giving you trouble.
customer_reviews.author: K. WyattTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Screws simply do NOT stay put!! Someone will bust their ass!
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely hate to give this stool such a negative review because the quality of the wood is great, but the screws simply do not stay in and I am constantly tightening them. Considering this is a chair that is meant to be sat upon,and one day when I've not had the time to tighten the screws, someone is going to bust their ass when this stool comes apart underneath them, I ultimately foresee it failing at the one job it is supposed to do. Sadly, one star.
customer_reviews.author: Sofia White

customer_reviews.title: Looks great, but buy your own hardware
customer_reviews.text: Stool appears to be in good order. I say appears because I have yet to put one together entirely. I have stripped 2 screws with a power drill, so I figured I would use hand tools and I stripped a screw with that too. It is to be expected that included hardware is cheap but holy balls, this is the first time I have had to order new hardware to complete an item thanks to how soft the screws are that wdre provided. Point is: the stools look good, but you should have something on stand by to replace the included screws
customer_reviews.author: Mark C. Maxwell

customer_reviews.title: Hard wood soft screws
customer_reviews.text: We bought two of these; one shipped missing one screw. The screws themselves are hex-head, requiring an Allen wrench (supplied). The pieces are only partially pre-drilled which is an issue because the screwheads are soft and easily stripped. The supplied wrench requires an extension (not supplied) because once the screws get into solid wood they become very difficult to turn. Don’t start one of these unless you have nothing else to do for an hour or so. On the positive side, if you are able to put one together properly they are sturdy and attractive. Bottom line-next time I’ll spend the extra money for one already assembled.
customer_reviews.author: James R Gaylord Jr

customer_reviews.title: Does the trick!
customer_reviews.text: These just arrived today. Took a little over an hour to assemble two of them. They won’t Be super comfortable, but will work for what is needed. Sturdy enough for kids and smaller adults... not sure if they’re sturdy enough for anyone close to the weight limit (200lbs). Arrived intact and well packaged, with no scratches. Wish they had included a small amount of wood glue to hold the screw covers in place. Color is a very pretty, dark, walnut brown.
customer_reviews.author: MC

customer_reviews.title: THIS STOOL HURT ME!!!!!!!  NEVER BUY IT.  ITS DANGEROUS. I DONT KNOW HOW AMAZON SELLS IT!!!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this stool for my kitchen for my use only while I cook. My weight is 116 pounds, that means, I am not too heavy... The wood between the framing broke when I was stepping down and hurt me big time. My feet is bleeding (If I could I would upload pictures of it). NEVER BUY THIS. IS IS A DANGEROUS STOOL. I am glad this happened with me not with one of my kids!!! I don’t even know how amazon sells it.
customer_reviews.author: Ida

customer_reviews.title: Make sure you have an allen wrench set.
customer_reviews.text: I was able to use a screw driver set and pair of pliers to similar (if significantly slower) effect and it was only needed for attaching the seat to the legs. Otherwise, seems sturdy and worth the 30 bucks. I'm using it to practice finger-style guitar with. I'm 5'11 and will have to saw about an inch off the legs to make it perfect. Maybe just a touch more, we'll see once the cushion I ordered comes in.
customer_reviews.author: John Smith

customer_reviews.title: Nice looking, solid but not so comfortable
customer_reviews.text: After assembly the stool was handsome, very sturdy and strong. I found it to be uncomfortable because of its sharp edges and squared off design. Other reviews have pointed out a difficulty in assembling the stool. the problem I had was that the screws were binding in the holes so badly that I was unable to fully insert the screws. I think the problem was that lacquer had gotten into the holes. The solution I found and it's pretty easy, is to drill out the holes with a 7/32" drill bit. This size drill bit cleaned out the hole and still left lots of wood for the screw to bite into. Solid easy assembly was achieved.
customer_reviews.author: Angst Angstrum

customer_reviews.title: Perefect size, might be challenging to assemble.
customer_reviews.text: The assembly is pretty self explanatory but tightening the 4 screws under the seat is a struggle cause of tight area and using an allen key will test your patience. A ratchet with the right allen head will make things easier. But once assembled its a great saddle stool with a very reasonable price compared to the furniture stores around my area who carries this type. Available in two sizes makes it even better.
customer_reviews.author: AmanteNJ

customer_reviews.title: Assembly of legs was a nightmare
customer_reviews.text: This stool is exactly what I wanted. The directions were clear. The finished stool works fine. Assembly of the stringers to the legs was acceptable. However, using the small hex wrench provided to assemble the legs to the seat was horrible. The four long hex-head wood screws used to attach the legs to the seat required a lot of hand strength and the assembly was tedious. I tried other hex driver systems but the clearance was so limited that only the small hex wrench that came with the product fit.
customer_reviews.author: Timoneer

customer_reviews.title: poor quality
customer_reviews.text: We purchased two of these stools in June 2012. It's now December 2013 and one is broken completely (unusable, thrown away). The second is still functional, but some of the wood has chipped off one leg, making it very unattractive. I'm not happy with this purchase and the quality of these stools is abysmal. These were used in our kitchen at our counter. We don't eat there regularly, but they do get use. The seemed to fall apart just about every time we moved them to clean the floor (okay, exaggerating, but it was frustratingly often).
customer_reviews.author: EEM

customer_reviews.title: A Solid Saddle Seat
customer_reviews.text: Out of the box, I was surprised how attractive these affordable barstools were. Looks aside, it wasn’t easy to assemble FIVE of them, but they’re sturdy with minimal visual flaws. Expect each awkward leg screw to require at least 30 turns with the included Allen wrench on a 30 minute assembly, so these aren’t for lazy buyers. For what you save in $$, you’ll spend in elbow grease assembling them. Good buy though & fully recommended to anyone on a budget with taste.
customer_reviews.author: Customer

customer_reviews.title: A very sturdy stool
customer_reviews.text: I ordered two stools to fit under my island in the kitchen. The assembly was easy, but what was a challenge, was tightening the screws. My daughter and I really struggled to get them tight, but in the end, I asked my grandson to finish tightening them. They're now nice and snug. The stools look great in my kitchen, and they're sturdy and look awesome. The only issue I had, was the small covers they include to hide the screws wouldn't stay on, even though I used glue. Other than that. love them and would recommend them. I've also gotten lots of compliments.
customer_reviews.author: Deanna G

customer_reviews.title: A few defects
customer_reviews.text: The parts were well packed, although there was a small chip on one of the long cross bars (part D). One of the short wood screws (part G) "bottomed out" before the other long cross bar was tight, and as a result that bar is not tight and the wood plug (part I) does not fit all the way in the screw hole. The hex wrench provided "rounded off" early and I had to find another one to complete the installation. The end result, even with these defects, seems capable of being used like it is intended as a kitchen stool.
customer_reviews.author: B.D.

customer_reviews.title: Good quality, use different screws!
customer_reviews.text: Good quality but an absolute pain to put together! I bought 2 only put one together why can’t they give you normal screws? You get one of those little pieces of metal crap that only fits in the square screws they give you. My knuckles were scratched but the time I got one put together and it was still Wobbly. The 2nd one is still in its box 2 years later! Lol but it is made of pretty good wood and looks nice when put together. Just get you some different screws.
customer_reviews.author: Amber

customer_reviews.title: Assembly required
customer_reviews.text: Beautiful sturdy stool. I found it very difficult to assemble. The directions are very good but make sure to read them all fbefore you start assembly. I'm a strong woman and had a really hard time using the allen wrench to turn the screws. I had to resort to a racheting driver to get the screws in. The long screws attaching the legs to the seat were the worse. One of the heads stripped and I ended up using pliers to get the last screw secure. This is a very nice stool and the price is the lowest I found but be prepared for a difficult time assembling it.
customer_reviews.author: Terry

customer_reviews.title: Nice looking not so easy to assemble.
customer_reviews.text: The product itself is nice looking and when assembled feels and looks great. The assembly portion is not as Easy as described by others. The screws are easy to strip and the hex wrench provided is short and does help much for the assembly portion. We bought two chairs, the first one we had issues with 3 screws (did not fully go in and when trying to removed we were not able to as they started to strip), at the end we found a way to get them out and replaced them with conventional screws available in my tool box. The second chair we were not able to start the assembly as it came with two missing screws.
customer_reviews.author: Andres

customer_reviews.title: So far looks like decent chairs if you are under 200Lb.
customer_reviews.text: Have gotten 2 of these Winsome 29" bar stools couple days apart. Wooden parts are identical but hardwear differs. One that says made in Malaysia provide good quality screws. They look and feel strong. Easy to assemble. The screws that came in the box marked Thailand are cheap. Hence, way more efforts to assemble. Had a question (2 missing screws) to Winsome customer support. Got immediate response by email. Expecting to get the screws soon. Conclusion: Good product for a price. Good customer service. Recommend.
customer_reviews.author: enna

customer_reviews.title: Excellent stool when finished
customer_reviews.text: Stool is excellent, sturdy, not wobbly. Anyone who says their stool is wobbly probably put it together incorrectly. The Allen wrench provided is hot garbage, though. Do not use it. It was completely stripped by the screws in a heartbeat and became unusable. If I hadn't had a set of Allen wrenches I would've been SOL. Do not use the supplied Allen wrench. If you are getting this and don't have a set of Allen wrenches, get a set. They're not expensive and could come in handy later. The screws are actually really good quality which is why the wrench stripped and not the screws. Aside from that minor inconvenience it is an excellent stool.
customer_reviews.author: Usuallee

customer_reviews.title: Takes hours to put together
customer_reviews.text: I'm used to putting furniture together so the fact that these stools came flat-packed didn't scare me. Figuring out which piece goes where was easy, although the second stool lacked all the identifying markers (lucky I could use the first stool as a reference.) What drove me crazy was the hardware. You will have to screw 16 big fat screws into hard wood with a hex key. Very hard on the hands and VERY time-consuming and frustrating. The end product is OK.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Missing a assembly hole
customer_reviews.text: Love the look of this product. Ordered it in two different heights. The taller one was made perfectly, and while it took some time to assemble, the process was straightforward. However, this one had one predrilled hole not drilled. My husband had to make a hole, and the indent for the decorative cap to go into. However, we are lucky in that he actually had a drill bit almost big enough to make the proper size hole, and the knowledge to be able to make it just wider than the hole without destroying the leg all together.
customer_reviews.author: Heather

customer_reviews.title: Seem fairly sturdy and are visually attractive.
customer_reviews.text: I ordered two, they were waiting for me when I got home from work. Easy to put together. Only one stool had an instruction sheet included, this worked out for me because I ordered more than one and honestly don't need two pieces of paper. but I realize that may not be practical for all people. Seem fairly sturdy and are visually attractive. I purchased these because their simple design would not detract from my decor and they are fairly inexpensive.
customer_reviews.author: Melissa

customer_reviews.title: AWESOME stools for an AWESOME price!
customer_reviews.text: Don't think because of the price you will get crappy stools, This stool are GREAT! well worth the money. I bought 4 of them. The GOOD : - packaging was perfect, well protected and nicely wrapped. - all hardware and tools included. - wood construction is really good and clean, all edges are smooth and well varnished. - perfect alignments for all the holes. - easy to follow instruction, well detailed. - Solid , sturdy , and comfortable. - made in Thailand The BAD : - there is no bad I can find - wish I would of bought them earlier
customer_reviews.author: gabriel a gonzalez

customer_reviews.title: Real WOOD! Beautiful!
customer_reviews.text: What a nice surprise, these days all we find are particle board products.....but not this stool. It is extremely well made, easy to put together and sturdy. We read some of the bad reviews, not sure what happened to them but if you take a chance and order this stool you will be pleasantly surprised, we were. I see that several reviewer had problems, putting it together with the enclosed screws, yes, you can strip the heads, but you take your time and carefully screw the parts together you shouldn't have any problems!
customer_reviews.author: Shopper

customer_reviews.title: Very Tough to Put Toether
customer_reviews.text: The screws are much longer than necessary and hard to screw in all the way without hearing wood-cracking sounds. Once the legs are together, it is ridiculously tedious to attach the legs to the top because the Allen-wrench can only turn a short way and you have to keep taking it out and putting it back into the hole. Overall, the wood is very sturdy and the stain is a pretty walnut. I bought this at $24 prime, and wanted to test it before buying more. I will not buy another from this maker, I am going to try another.
customer_reviews.author: Victoria

customer_reviews.title: A decent stool for the price
customer_reviews.text: I hesitated to buy based on the reviews about assembly and sturdy construction. They were fairly easy to assemble if you have patience, go slow and use your own allen wrench (not the one provided). I heard some people say not to use a drill as you could strip the screws. But I used my own allen wrench and had no problems. Took about 15 minutes per stool to assemble. You might want to glue in the wood pegs over the holes, as they will fall out otherwise. I'm not sure how long it will last, but it serves my purposes just fine and looks decent. The color looks just like the picture; maybe a bit better.
customer_reviews.author: Pianogirl

customer_reviews.title: Winsome Saddle Seat
customer_reviews.text: Just finished assembling the first of the two I ordered> It is a very attractive piece of furniture and very solid. It will look good and last for years. Very modestly priced. Now for the problems: I finally gave up on the confusing instructions and looked at the picture and used my head to figure out how the part went together. The hex key wrench was a pain in my hand and fingers. The very tight corners where the legs fasten to the seat limits the rotation of the hex key to about 1/4 of a turn at a time. Takes forever to tighten the fastening screws. Even a standard screwdriver bit would be better.
customer_reviews.author: Dr. C. Bradenton

customer_reviews.title: Nice stool
customer_reviews.text: This can really be a chore to assemble. The hex screws don't go in so easily, but don't give up. Assemble only tightening a halfway just to get everything in place. Yes, some of the screws will look like they're going in wrong. Finish the ones that look fine first. With the apparently messed up screw holes, to my amazement, they went in just fine little by little. Screwing in the legs to the seat is cumbersome. You have to turn, release hex wrench, turn, release, repeat. Once it's finally assembled, it's sturdy. It looks and feels good.
customer_reviews.author: AlVan

customer_reviews.title: Good stool! Horrible hardware!
customer_reviews.text: If you can manage to put this stool together without stripping out multiple screws, you have accomplished a lot and you have yourself a great stool! That being said, the screws are horrible!! I ordered two stools. I learned from the first one and successfully put together the second. The second one is all messed up because I need to take it a part but can't because multiple screws are stripped!!! Ugh...
customer_reviews.author: TigerFan

customer_reviews.title: good for the price
customer_reviews.text: Get yourself two long (10"?) drill hex extensions, then cut off about a 1.5" section of the straight part of the included allen/hex wrench. Now get a hex to 1/4" adapter and 1/4" socket that the allen section fits into. now you'll have about a 2ft long set up that will help you fasten in the included screws. Worked like a charm. As far as the quality for the price, very good. if could give 4.5 stars I would have.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan Fish-on

customer_reviews.title: Need effort and mussels to assemble it.
customer_reviews.text: Takes a lots of effort and mussels to assemble it. The only tools came with products is an Allen screw. With a hole position under benches it was very hard and tight to turn the screw. I bought a bed frame the other day, also use Allen screws to tight in. But their design unlike these benches. It was very easy and no need any mussels to tight it. Only take two turns to lock it tight. These benches takes about 15 turns into wood. You need to use that small Allen screw to do a carpenter work. Took me and my wife 2 hours to assemble 4 of them.
customer_reviews.author: Kenny C

customer_reviews.title: Nice Finish, Sturdy
customer_reviews.text: This stool is NOT easy to put together using the tool supplied. I stripped one of the screws and had to go to the hardware store for a replacement. Once together, it is sturdy and the finish is really nice. I don't think it is comfortable, and I did not use it at my counter. I would not buy again. I would have returned it, but I would not take it apart for the almost $20 I paid for it.
customer_reviews.author: Love to Shop

customer_reviews.title: Bad Parts, Do Not Buy Unless Willing to Return for Replacement
customer_reviews.text: Could not finish safely assembling the item. A screw stripped despite being properly positioned and cannot be removed. I contacted the replacements email to ask for a new unit and have received no response. === Update === Changed to 3 stars because Amazon did eventually step in after being made aware of the issue and offer a replacement. They did make me responsible for disposal of the broken stool, since someone at the shipping center said it was too big for their consolidation boxes. The return process was a bit of a runaround.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: The Stools Suck,  Period...
customer_reviews.text: These stools are crap. I've ordered Winsome products many times and loved the items. The wood shatters on touch almost. I weigh 100 pounds so it's not my overpowering strength. It's impossible to box this crap up and send them back. I've taken them both to a cabinet maker to get this junk put together. Yes, it will probably cost more than the stools but I've already purchased the pub table. Very disappointed with Winsome and Amazon for allowing this.
customer_reviews.author: AngWms

customer_reviews.title: Poor Quality Control
customer_reviews.text: Easy shipping and nice flat packing, but missing critical parts for assembly. Upon unpacking it was missing 2 washers and the actual allen key needed for assembly. Once I used my own tools the pilot holes for all the screws were far too small which make assembly nearly impossible. I drilled out the holes and was able to put it together. Another tip...take the 8 screws out to remove the top so you can actually install the legs, otherwise, you can only move the allen key 1/4 turn at a time. Once its all together, its a decent piece for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Travis

customer_reviews.title: Looks Gorgeous
customer_reviews.text: Unnecessarily hard to assemble because its use of hex screws and Allen wrench. Pay attention to the outer corners of the legs when attaching so you don’t have to remove and start over like I did - learn from my mistake! I wasn’t strong enough to make the seams match at the bottom, so the stool is beautiful if you don’t look closely (until I get someone to help me). Now that it’s together it looks great and is exactly what I wanted. Removed one star for difficulty in assembling.
customer_reviews.author: Betty Berkshires

customer_reviews.title: Great stool, might have wrong parts!
customer_reviews.text: Honestly if the product is packaged correctly and all of the right parts are included this is a great stool!!!!!! We ordered two, the first one went together no problem. The second stool did not include all of the correct parts and was unable to put it together. Luckily, Amazon stood by their product and quickly sent a replacement. The replacement stool went together no problem. We have been using these for a couple months and they have stood up nicely from daily use and children's messes and food spills! Overall, I would buy again. It is a great value for stools!!!! Just have patience and check all the parts in the box!
customer_reviews.author: KDF

customer_reviews.title: Cheap pot metal screws, stripped with a hand powered Allen wrench!
customer_reviews.text: This product is solid if you can get the cheap Chinese metal screws to drive into the wood! I stripped the hex screws on two of 4 stools with an Allen wrench that takes 47 careful turns per screw! I got 2 out of 4 together without stripping a screw. It’s really annoying when it’s the last screw on both stools. Pre drilling to a slightly larger diameter would help if anyone is listening. The wood is solid as concrete though.
customer_reviews.author: shaun

customer_reviews.title: Very sturdy kitchen island stool
customer_reviews.text: I ordered two of theses stools. They arrived promptly. The assembling instruction is straightforward and easy to follow, plus the assembling tips provided by other reviewers here. The most difficult part of the assembling is to screw the legs into the seat base and screw the bard into the legs! We didn’t purchase the professional assembling but thanks to our professional tools. The stools came out perfectly and fit our kitchen island! I wish there could be screw ready holes in this product which may make the assembling easier.
customer_reviews.author: stocknewbie

customer_reviews.title: Stool or sawhorse
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic! I got this and the natural set thinking I would only keep one kind. I decided to keep both. Will place one set in the garage and use for seats and sawhorses. Excellent quality, structurally sound, stylish, and affordable. Can't go wrong with these. Backless so you can tuck them under the counter and not have to reach around seatbacks if you still need to use the counter standing. After assembling two chairs, I realized the legs were marked in red to indicate which corners they go to. This took away the challenging experience of figuring out the chair puzzle. Long braces on top. Make sure to buy the right height.
customer_reviews.author: iGoo

customer_reviews.title: Best to read and follow directions on this
customer_reviews.text: Great assembly directions including a “white dot” marking for main leg/seat attachment that helps A LOT. I used wood glue on joints (since I weigh more that the 250lb rating-well I’m 6’ 6” so...) after first “dry assembly” to make sure I wasn’t wrong in my placement. No need for clamping since the Allen Head Screws work well. Went together in about 25mins.
customer_reviews.author: cliffnotes

customer_reviews.title: Good Quality for the Price
customer_reviews.text: Good quality for the price. Better than Ikea. Uses one piece rail and dowel construction, screwed to reinforce. Assembly is straight forward if you are mechanically minded. If you have access to a drill/driver with hex bit use it. Get some sandpaper, clean off the finish on the dowels. But some wood glue if you don't already have it and apply to dowel and mating hole. This WILL make these Stools last a lot, lot longer. No backrest means that people won't lean back and put extra stress on the joints. I have short term rental properties and know what people can do to unwittingly break furniture.
customer_reviews.author: Discerning Buyer

customer_reviews.title: Stool OK but watch out for the screws provided
customer_reviews.text: Stool itself is decent quality but the screws provided for assembly were pretty crappy. I bought two of these stools and by the time I was finishing the second one, the little allen wrench they provided was pretty much stripped on both ends, and ended up completely stripping the last two screws before they could be fully seated. Had to take them back out (luckily the reverse direction was not as stripped) and replace them with two similarly-sized stainless phillips-head screws I fortunately had in my spare screws jar. But once assembled, the stools are nice. I just wish they had provided better-quality screws. Or at least a few spares.
customer_reviews.author: Murphy Shea

customer_reviews.title: Great Value! Great Quality!
customer_reviews.text: These were not as difficult to assemble as some other reviewers said. Tip: read the directions and take your time. Don’t let husband take over with power drill. I had all screws in place and ready to tighten, husband pulled out cordless screwdriver and stripped screw right away. Just take the time to assemble manually and you won’t have a problem. Great quality almost identical to what I’ve bought at a furniture store for 1/4 of the price. I bought 3 for less than 1 chair at Walmart.
customer_reviews.author: A.K.

customer_reviews.title: You Get What You Pay For
customer_reviews.text: I bought a couple of these about 2 months ago. They seemed ok in the beginning, but are coming apart after minimal use. Both wobble while, but the screws are still tight. They were easy to put together and took about 30 min for both. I still wouldn’t recommend. Pay the extra money for something that will last. We’ll be replacing them soon before someone gets hurt.
customer_reviews.author: Robby

customer_reviews.title: Solid Chair, Solid Price
customer_reviews.text: Enjoy the chair and the color. They are sturdy, but a tad cumbersome to put together. It's just a bunch of screws but they aren't the easier to crank, but to be fair their might not be an alternative. My main reason for 4 stars is there was a small splat of red paint on two legs- they mark leg position with a red dot on the bottom of leg and it got sloppy. Worth getting, strong, and still look good.
customer_reviews.author: Mike-----

customer_reviews.title: Quality chair assembly just takes time
customer_reviews.text: Quality chair assembly just takes time We purchased four of these. I recommend using the Allen key and not a drill. Take your time assemble them correctly you will be happy. I used a torque bit to screw in the leg braces. And the Allen key they send with the package I used to screw the legs onto the seat which is critical that you do not strip them out!!!
customer_reviews.author: Russ - S

customer_reviews.title: you get what you pay for
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to give this item 5 stars but I can’t because of assembly. It at first seemed really easy until the very end when you have to screw in all the legs. My drill wouldn’t allow me to fit in because of the shape so I had to hand do it but the nails are so cheap the stripped so easily. You will need a vice grip to really secure this
customer_reviews.author: salvatore s

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful sturdy and simple assembly
customer_reviews.text: I was skeptical after reading mostly problematic assembly reviews. However if you take your time and do not fully tighten your screws until the end you should have absolutely no problems with hurt hands or lack of fit or any of these other things that were listed it was like putting together any other piece of furniture no problems and it is beautiful and sturdy
customer_reviews.author: Melanie H

customer_reviews.title: Beware of cheap screws
customer_reviews.text: We purchased several of these stools in the past and have been very happy with them. However, THIS one came with much cheaper screws (the previous stools included extra screws--of much higher quality). I had to use a few of the saved screws as these stripped almost instantly. Previous stools took 20-30minutes to assemble. This one took an hour and was a pain! Same brand, same stock number, but this one was manufactured in a different country. They must have changed suppliers and it shows!
customer_reviews.author: KatherineH

customer_reviews.title: Does not stay tight/safe
customer_reviews.text: Hex heads on screws do not fit wrench--holes not deep enough. for a wrench/drill. Seat very difficult to screw on. Not enough room for fingers/hands to screw legs on using poor wrench. Then, when I used it a few times, it is terribly loose again. Screws do not stay tight. A loose stool is dangerous. If not for the trouble and cost, I would return. Simply a poor product from a questionable manufacturer. They have to know of the problems and do not correct.
customer_reviews.author: mike d

customer_reviews.title: Nice stools
customer_reviews.text: Really nice looking stools & wood does appear to be solid. The walnut color is pleasing. Agreed with most others that putting them together is fairly simple but the wood screws are difficult to get in. I consider myself a handy/strong girl, but gave up after a half hour or so and trying to screw the screws in with the allen wrench. I had my husband do it instead, and use his tools to finish the assembly. He didn't really like the construction, but for $23 each, it's what you pay for. I would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Melody Justine

customer_reviews.title: Solid and a great deal
customer_reviews.text: These stools are solid, I purchased two, put one together with just the screws and it was solid, a bit wobble but nothing that couldn't be resolved by taking it apart, rebuilding and adding Gorilla Wood glue to all of the joints before reassembling. I built the second one using Gorilla Wood Glue from the start and this thing is SOLID! Slight color variance from one stool to the next, but not a big deal. The screws may be a bit tight to drive in by hand at first, don't use a power driver to get them in, just apply a bit of bees wax or chap-stick to the start of the thread and you're good to go.
customer_reviews.author: Mario

customer_reviews.title: Great Quality!
customer_reviews.text: I’m very pleased with this purchase. The stools are simple to put together with the use of the included Allen wrench, and looks great! Personally, I think you get really good quality for what you pay for. I highly recommend. Also, Thank you to the Amazon Team of Professionals for all the deliveries and hard work you have displayed during these times of uncertainty.
customer_reviews.author: JD

customer_reviews.title: Very nice stools
customer_reviews.text: These stools are very attractive and are exactly what I wanted and expected. I just received and assembled so I cannot vouch for how they will hold up. Assembly is a pain. As instructed by Justin and Michelle in their review, I discarded the wrench that came with the stool and used one from my own toolkit. It was a slow process but easy. Assembly is the only reason I did not give a 5 star rating. These stools (I purchased 2) will be used as additional seating around our dining table. Our chairs are 24" high so the stools are the perfect height. I will come back and update later as the stools are used.
customer_reviews.author: Native Texan

customer_reviews.title: Missing parts and no reply from the manufacturer on replacing them.
customer_reviews.text: I ordered one and it arrived yesterday. There were no instructions in the box, but it looked easy enough to assemble. But as I assembled it, I discovered that it was missing the 2 wooden supports that go from there front legs to the back legs. There screws were included. My wrists were too sore to disassemble and ship back to Amazon, so I write the manufacturer to see if they would replace them. It's been a day now and no response. The stool seems pretty sturdy without these supports, but looks bad. If I don't hear from them by tomorrow, I will disassemble it and return it to Amazon and buy a different one.
customer_reviews.author: Reecherd

customer_reviews.title: JUNK
customer_reviews.text: What a waste of money. It looks good but is impossible to put together. Pilot holes for screws were inadequate and after replacing some of the longer ones, I still can’t get the short ones to turn in all the way and the hex heads are stripped so I can’t get them out to be replaced. A garbage product that deserves no better than burning.
customer_reviews.author: Nancy S.

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy stools to sit on and look great.
customer_reviews.text: I bought six of these stools and use them around our two kitchen islands. They were easy to assemble. I did on my own add wood glue to all the joints before screwing everything together just to ensure the stools would be sturdy for many years of use. They have a nice finish and look great.
customer_reviews.author: Roger

customer_reviews.title: Great stool, terrible wrench
customer_reviews.text: This stool is exactly what I was looking for at an incredible price. It's good looking and very sturdy. Assembly was simple, but tightening the screws was a bit of a pain. The Allen wrench tool provided is total garbage. It stripped almost immediately. You'll almost certainly need to get your own. I'm still giving this product 5 stars, because the chair is pretty-much perfect and the price can't be beat. But be aware you'll need to find a 4mm Allen wrench (with a long handle...you meed some leverage to tighten the screws).
customer_reviews.author: W.T.

customer_reviews.title: Wide Seats!
customer_reviews.text: I love the width of the seats, I ordered three for my boys to eat at the counter. After you put together the first one, the others are easy. Did not like the tool they had becuase one area you can turn it ( you can but not with ease), so i had to buy a powertool with the attachment otherwise it would have taken me days and cursing. The chiars are nice, sturdy and I like the overall. They do have a option fo rthem to be built but for two only so I ignored that during the chekout, never again. I will always have my items put together if they offer.
customer_reviews.author: Cat-ism

customer_reviews.title: Watch-out
customer_reviews.text: After being lost for days by UPS shipping/tracking, the Thailand (where it's made) poor-quality alloy Allen screws to assemble this stool, are soft & useless to drive into the finely finished hard-wood, as screw-heads become quickly deformed. Wood holes then must be re-drilled and new screws bought locally to fit. Nice if you like quality of wood, though, as I'm a wood-worker.
customer_reviews.author: Svenska

customer_reviews.title: Very bad screws provided. The heads wore off (holes not fully drilled.
customer_reviews.text: The wood material is good (looks good), but the screws provided with it and the AllenKey were so low quality that the edges of the screw wore off (using the allenkey provided with the product). The product has become useless with the provided screws. Did the screws come from China? Very disappointed with the product
customer_reviews.author: Ash

customer_reviews.title: Are you capable? Want a stool?
customer_reviews.text: There are 12 screws and 4 washers. They only fit one way and are marked. There's a hex wrench. If you can't manage that then you've probably been using sea belts wrong your whole life and are lucky to be alive. This is my second set, the first lasted three years. At $25 that's less than a dollar a month. If that's not good enough then go to an artisanal lumber emporium and get a gender studies major to whittle you something with an adz for three grand. It's mail order ass furniture. Don't over think it.
customer_reviews.author: Raif10

customer_reviews.title: Great value!
customer_reviews.text: Holy value steal, Batman! I snagged two of these stools when the price dropped to $18, and they are incredible quality for the price. My husband was skeptical of the quality when I told him how much I paid for them, but after assembling them he was very impressed! He now uses one as his go-to seat when working on the computer at the kitchen counter. The stools are exactly as pictured and very sturdy. The 24-inch height is perfect for my counter-height kitchen island.
customer_reviews.author: HebbieWebbie

customer_reviews.title: Quality stools but pain to assemble
customer_reviews.text: The stools when assembled are nice and work as expected. Assembly was a pain. They include a 4mm hex key for all of the screws but if you used that each stool would probably take 4+ hours to assemble. Based on another review I used a racheting socket wrench and had to order a set of hex sockets. If I order something like this again I'll probably look for ones already assembled. Whatever increased price I had to pay would likely be worth it.
customer_reviews.author: jmosher

customer_reviews.title: Good value
customer_reviews.text: Bought this in order to give my grandchildren haircuts. It places them high enough to allow me to reach their head without the back of a chair getting in the way. It’s also sturdy enough for an adult to sit on. Went together real easy with instructions provided. A nice rich wood color. I use it to display my orchid in the breakfast nook when not giving haircuts!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Disappointment
customer_reviews.text: I'm too old and too frustrated to deal with this mess. The screws didn't match the ones in the instructions and the finish on the wood is terrible. The holes where the screws are supposed to be placed are either not fully cut all the way through or the holes were out of place, misaligning the screws. If it weren't for my old age and distance of a postal office, I wouldve requested a refund. Super upset and hope that nobody else wastes their money on such a bad quality product. I definitely will be looking elsewhere and NEVER coming back to this company nor product. Best of luck to all of you.
customer_reviews.author: Taz B.

customer_reviews.title: Leg coming apart from cross bar
customer_reviews.text: Hello -- if someone from the company could contact me, I would appreciate it. I called the number under support on our Amazon site and a fax machine picked it up????? I have not had it long as you can see by my order and the full socket where the screw goes into the crossbar came out, making the stool unsafe. Sorry I had to post this here, but could not at this time figure out how to get in touch with you. This was an expensive purchase for the stool and I did not expect this -- thank you for your help.
customer_reviews.author: Richard

customer_reviews.title: Could have been designed better
customer_reviews.text: Nice stool and it will probably hold up for several years. The problem is the assembly. What should have taken 15 min ended up taking an hour and a half because the little Allen wrench provided was totally inadequate and awkward to maneuver in the small space under the seat where each of the four legs attach. Had the predrilled hole in each leg been angled slightly differently, I could have used my screw gun with a proper allen bit. Maddening and tiresome.
customer_reviews.author: Joe Roman

customer_reviews.title: Quality but Difficult Assembly
customer_reviews.text: I really like this stool but they were a real pain to put together. I bought 4, so I had my work ahead of me. Many of the holes weren't big enough so I had to drill the holes with my electric drill. Also, the Allen wrench provided is a little soft and strips pretty easily. Luckily, I saved an Allen wrench from another self assembly project and used it. But be careful because the screws also strip easily. I subtracted a star because of the difficult assembly/inadequate screw holes and bad hardware.
customer_reviews.author: Amy

customer_reviews.title: wobbly!!!!!!!!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: This stool is so cute and looks like it would be sturdy but the legs begin to wobble within a month of putting it together and continue to wobble even with daily tightening of the screws. We keep the allen wrench on the bar and tighten the legs before sitting down every single day! It's a huge hassle and I'm finally getting rid of them. I DO NOT RECOMMEND.
customer_reviews.author: Kwisatz Haderach

customer_reviews.title: Not so easy to assemble it
customer_reviews.text: The assembly ergonomics is terrible, the holes are not pre threaded, so good luck with the mini-tool. But if you want to use a power tool the screws are really easy to strip them up. I bought 2, I assembled one and the other is sitting on the floor until I get another screw I stripped. After assembled it is sturdy and good looking product
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Assembly
customer_reviews.text: I purchased two of these previously and had no problems assembling them. With this purchase I am finding it impossible to fully tighten two of the screws holding the legs to the seat. I will contact customer service and see how it goes. Apart from this current problem I am very pleased with the product.
customer_reviews.author: Tony R

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable and stylish
customer_reviews.text: Comfortable and stylish. Study wood. Better quality than I expected. A couple of recommendation for assembly. (1) The assembly was simple, but each one took me about 20-30 minutes to assemble because you can only get a 1/2 turn on the Allen wrench nut with the tool provided (or any "L" shaped Allen wrench.) You can't fit a normal size drill with a hex wrench into the base. If I was putting 4-5 of these together, I would get a ratchet wrench with a hex key. Something like this:  (2) I glued all of the dowel connections. I'm not sure if it made a difference but the connections on my chairs don't wiggle.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff Pitcher

customer_reviews.title: Screwed
customer_reviews.text: I screwed and screwed and screwed. They need to tap those holes. Took me a full day each, my hands hurt and I couldn't seem to get all of them 100 percent in. No help with power tools. Has to be done manually with the key. Once together though, I am fully convinced Armageddon couldn't get them apart. :)) Great stool but just too miserable to assemble... can they send them fully together maybe?
customer_reviews.author: Cicily Bunny

customer_reviews.title: Great value for the money.
customer_reviews.text: I am dealing with knee and back problems and needed a stool for the kitchen when I'm cooking. This fit the bill. I love Asian look and it's comfy enough for what I wanted. This model is tall enough for me to see over my counter. Easy to assemble and solid build. Be sure to get the felt feet so you don't damage your floor.
customer_reviews.author: G

product_meta.title: Winsome 94089 Satori Stool, 29", Walnut
product_meta.description: Size:29"Contemporary Saddle Seat 29" wood counter height stools in Walnut finish. Solid wood construction; designed in the US, produced in Thailand of natural hardwood. Ships ready to assemble with all hardware and tools included. This new style seat is comfortable and sleek.
feature_bullets: From Winsome Wood, 29-inch high saddle seat stool for use at the kitchen counter or home bar
Crafted in solid beech wood with attractive walnut finish
Broad contoured seat; square legs with supportive rungs for sturdy base
Also available in 24-inch height and matte black finish; home assembly required
Measures 18 inches wide by 16 inches deep by 29 inches high; Seat dimension : 17.50”W x 8.90”D | sold individually

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.3 out of 5 stars4,333 ratings4.3 out of 5 stars
